comment: * Base columns for tables that contain text-based SMSs.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_ALL
variables.comment: Message type: all messages.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_INBOX
variables.comment: Message type: inbox.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_SENT
variables.comment: Message type: sent messages.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_DRAFT
variables.comment: Message type: drafts.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_OUTBOX
variables.comment: Message type: outbox.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_FAILED
variables.comment: Message type: failed outgoing message.

variables.name: MESSAGE_TYPE_QUEUED
variables.comment: Message type: queued to send later.

variables.name: TYPE
variables.comment:
* The type of message. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: THREAD_ID
variables.comment:
* The thread ID of the message. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: ADDRESS
variables.comment:
* The address of the other party. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: DATE
variables.comment:
* The date the message was received. *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: DATE_SENT
variables.comment:
* The date the message was sent. *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: READ
variables.comment:
* Has the message been read? *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: SEEN
variables.comment:
* Has the message been seen by the user? The "seen" flag determines * whether we need to show a notification. *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: STATUS
variables.comment:
* {@code TP-Status} value for the message, or -1 if no status has been received. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: STATUS_NONE
variables.comment: TP-Status: no status received.

variables.name: STATUS_COMPLETE
variables.comment: TP-Status: complete.

variables.name: STATUS_PENDING
variables.comment: TP-Status: pending.

variables.name: STATUS_FAILED
variables.comment: TP-Status: failed.

variables.name: SUBJECT
variables.comment:
* The subject of the message, if present. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: BODY
variables.comment:
* The body of the message. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: PERSON
variables.comment:
* The ID of the sender of the conversation, if present. *

Type: INTEGER (reference to item in {@code content://contacts/people})

variables.name: PROTOCOL
variables.comment:
* The protocol identifier code. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: REPLY_PATH_PRESENT
variables.comment:
* Is the {@code TP-Reply-Path} flag set? *

Type: BOOLEAN

variables.name: SERVICE_CENTER
variables.comment:
* The service center (SC) through which to send the message, if present. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: LOCKED
variables.comment:
* Is the message locked? *

Type: INTEGER (boolean)

variables.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID
variables.comment:
* The subscription to which the message belongs to. Its value will be * < 0 if the sub id cannot be determined. *

Type: INTEGER (long)

variables.name: MTU
variables.comment:
* The MTU size of the mobile interface to which the APN connected
         * @hide

variables.name: ERROR_CODE
variables.comment:
* Error code associated with sending or receiving this message *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CREATOR
variables.comment:
* The identity of the sender of a sent message. It is * usually the package name of the app which sends the message. *

Note: * This column is read-only. It is set by the provider and can not be changed by apps. *

Type: TEXT
